title: Ren: Human-Heartedness
description: A short lesson to help you apply Ren: Human-Heartedness.

hook.text: Confucius was asked to sum up his philosophy in one word. He answered: ren â€” human-heartedness.

buildup.text: Ren means benevolence, compassion, and treating others as fully human.

discovery.text: It starts with empathy. Confucius said: 'Do not do to others what you do not want done to yourself.'

twist.text: Ren isn't just a feeling. It requires action â€” kindness, respect, and care expressed through behavior.

climax.text: A society built on ren has less need for laws because people naturally treat each other well.

punchline.text: Be human to other humans. That's the whole teaching.
